body:
## New Performance Report

* **Addition**: 482M data file (2,550,000 pair span), 1.6G index file,  in 5min on SSD 
* Up to 10,000 tps, to save spans ( pairs )

Add the following config to zoo.cfg file:

minSessionTimeout=< min session time out >
maxSessionTimeout=< max session time out >

Refactor whole inheritance tree.
Provide 
* **ConstructorInterceptPoint**
* **InstanceMethodsInterceptPoint**
* **StaticMethodsInterceptPoint**. 

Each one of them need to return a string represent a class name, and must _instanctof_ 
* **InstanceConstructorInterceptor**
* **InstanceMethodsAroundInterceptor**
* **StaticMethodsAroundInterceptor**.

And all plugins have been refactored, but not been test. @ascrutae 

Check all changes to commit https://github.com/wu-sheng/sky-walking/commit/fe1702da368060aaede4ea4e4d83314e16a9b8ca

use `sky-walking.config` as optional config file.

* `-Dusername=`username
* `-DapplicationCode=`application_code
* `-Dservers=`routing servers list

因为点击各节点会弹出模态框，所以json数据格式稍微有点变动
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13374074/20882953/7f6f025c-bb1e-11e6-866c-0add7237b290.png)
业务字段部分为一行，不要换行，如果需要换行用“\n”表示。
@wu-sheng

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13374074/20883032/f127add6-bb1e-11e6-82ab-70b605877301.png)
 模态框雏形

Change tech implements:
1. Create a application-toolkit, which application  developers need dependency it. And it will not trigger any problem, even sky-walking's javaagent is not working.
1. sky-walking's agent will alter toolkit's class source code dynamically, and implements the real purpose.

Provide log4j, log4j2 in 2.0-2016, and opentracing support in 2.1-2017.
@ascrutae , codes have been pulled. please test to make sure it works.
Ref a issue: https://github.com/wu-sheng/sky-walking/issues/71, for log4j2. Hope to be resolved in 2.1-2017
This whole UI will be provided in version 2.1-2017. On the next iteration.
Bug should be reproduced in https://github.com/ascrutae/skywalking-log4j2-test, but not for now.

* InstanceConstructorInterceptor
* InstanceMethodsAroundInterceptor
* StaticMethodsAroundInterceptor
All three interceptors have been tested in plugins.

log4j, log4j2, logback in all in support list.
Leave OT spec in next version. ref https://github.com/wu-sheng/sky-walking/issues/72
All resolved in https://github.com/wu-sheng/sky-walking/issues/62
https://github.com/wu-sheng/sky-walking/issues/72 will be better.
@wu-sheng How should I do?

I think it should be **Nothing**  to change. We will use dynamic class source change tech to inject a filter. Maybe later, I need your help to confirm which framework's class and method should be intercepted.
Thank you!
Add a new application toolkit: skywalking-toolkit-opentracing
Use opentracing toolkit activation to support this rpc framework.

Can you describe the conflict, we have aware of the `%x`'s confliction. But I want to make sure what happen on your side.

When we use `%x` on testing, no error occurs. Does this trigger NDC not working?
Sorry, I just read codes without testing. I think the NDC may not be printed in this case.
Fixed in next version. Seem you are right.
Closed. ref to #75
Fix all major classes comments about sky-walking agent.

New RocketMQ git moves to https://github.com/apache/incubator-rocketmq.
Wait for RocketMQ next release. @vongosling

Here is the add request span example.

Add request spans:
```
POST /spans/request
[{
"traceId":"212017.1484100963000.-215172798.6571.52.2",
"parentLevelId":"",
"levelId":0,
"startTime":0,
"routeKey":123456,
"tags":{
    "viewpoint":"http://localhost:8080/skywalking/test",
    "hostname":"192.168.1.1",
    "error.status":"0",
    "process_no":"123456",
    "applicationCode":"test",
    "call.desc":"W",
    "call.type":"S",
    "username":"test"
    }
},
...
]
```

Add ack spans:
```
POST /spans/ack
[{
"traceId":"212017.1484100963000.-215172798.6571.52.2",
"parentLevelId":"",
"levelId":0,
"cost":14,
"routeKey":123456,
"tags": {
    "viewpoint":"http://localhost:8080/skywalking/test",
    "error.status":"0",
    "applicationCode":"test",
    "username":"test"
    }
},
...
]
```
In v2.2 iterator cycle, I will add comments on server-side codes.

New demo trace tree. @rayzhang0603 , I think you will be interested in opentracing-motan trace tree node. 😁

@andot , I think hprose-java opentracing will be supported automaticly, by skywalking-opentracing-toolkit. 

See https://github.com/wu-sheng/sky-walking/issues/72

@bensigelman, this is my trace tree visualization with motan-opentracing node. 

motan-opentracing filter uses spi to find tracer implementation.
I will close this issue, be ready for 2.1-release. If anything goes right, we can reopen this.
@wu-sheng nice! thanks for `@bensigelman`ing me.

The whole new structure of **Distributed Trace**. This is only **Logic Concept**. We will discuss about how to implement this concept, how to storage, and how to visualize.

```
Traces-DAG ( Logic, across-proceas, across-thread )

  Trace ( in thread )
      TraceId ( Global Unique Id or Random.long )
      StartTime
      EndTime
      PrimaryParentTraceRef
      ParentTracieRefs ( list : support batch process )
          ParentTraceId
          ParentSpanId

      Span ( list )
           SpanId
           ParentSpanId
           OperationName
           StartTime
           EndTime
           Tags
           Log(error, event, stack)
```

There will be two ways to store **Logic distributed trace**. For the notice, `request/ack span` things did NOT bring any clear advantage, so I will be deprecated.

We will go to traditional trace/span thing. But we have three options here.
1. Store a `in-thread` trace object, after it finished (`in-thread`), including all spans in it.
1. Store separated span objects, after the trace finished.
1. Store separated span objects, like ^^^ one, but not until the trace finished, just after the span finished.

These three ways don't have much differences, if we store spans in an Elastic Search Cluster, which I think it's the best choice for now. But we still need a decision, so I think here need a vote.

In Elastic Search Cluster, it is very easy to deploy, easy to index(traceid/spanid/parent-stuffs/tags/logs), easy to search(same as index).

Maybe, if we want to follow OpenTracing spec more, I can make this concept changes:
- Traces-DAG -> Trace
- Trace -> SubTrace / TraceSegment

> Store a in-thread trace object, after it finished (in-thread), including all spans in it.

+1, javaagent -> server node, the analysis is based on `TraceSegment`, it will be easier to find **root causes**. (e.g. slow sql, slow rpc, high frequency db access, etc.)
Dev on [branch feature/3.0](https://github.com/wu-sheng/sky-walking/tree/feature/3.0)
Dev on [branch feature/3.0](https://github.com/wu-sheng/sky-walking/tree/feature/3.0)

> Store separated span objects, like ^^^ one, but not until the trace finished, just after the span finished

+1, The amount of data sent to the storage node can be controlled, and this solution can solve  the agent will take up a lot of memory  in the case of the large number of synchronous calls
@ascrutae  I Saw your point. But how to process the `find causes`? You need to cache on server side, and, clearly, it costs the same memory. Also skywalking will face tons of hardware requirements.

I just mean the span data generated during the execution of the trace will be stored in memory and the data will be sent out until the trace is complete. If the trace is high and the application contains a large number of such trace, it will have an effect on the application memory

The new `TraceSegment` Object has been released. You can preview it:

https://github.com/wu-sheng/sky-walking/blob/feature/3.0/skywalking-commons/skywalking-trace/src/main/java/com/a/eye/skywalking/trace/TraceSegment.java
@ascrutae , still, you don't consider of the analysis scenario, how to do that, and how to do that easily. This is a major point of version 3.0

@wu-sheng it's a little scary to actually implement full DAG support from a visualization standpoint... certainly can be done (see X-Trace from Berkeley, etc), but lots of corner cases.

I like the idea of modeling a "trace" as a DAG of sub-trees (where each tree is, well, a *tree*: a single-parent-only DAG). Then you can visualize every tree in straightforward tree-like ways and only handle the complicated multi-parent cases between trees. Not sure if this makes sense, I realize I'm leaving out a lot of detail.

@bensigelman  , I have the same concern as you are. So, in here, I just change the data-structure, and you can see it is a DAG model. 

In visualization, I prepare to just show the trace-tree by traceSegementId and PrimaryParentTraceRef. It is still a Tree, rather than a real DAG (single-parent-only, as your mentioned). And for `ParentTracieRefs`, I want to give only some links in UI. If the users click it, they will see the detail of sub-tree.

The major data structures of trace are in these packages:
- https://github.com/wu-sheng/sky-walking/tree/feature/3.0/skywalking-commons/skywalking-trace/src/main/java/com/a/eye/skywalking/trace
- https://github.com/wu-sheng/sky-walking/tree/feature/3.0/skywalking-sniffer/skywalking-api/src/main/java/com/a/eye/skywalking/context
Invalid pull request.

谢谢楼上各位， 已搞定。另外补充一下，让其他人少走弯路。

1. 在运行clean install时， 可能会报错 javax.jms.1.1.jar 不存在（到sun官网上是下载不到的），最好提前将这个jar下载到自己的本地库。
http://mvnrepository.com/artifact/javax.jms/jms/1.1

2. 加上 -DskipTests， 否则会有测试用例报错。

Done.

@NicholasQu 

> 在运行clean install时， 可能会报错 javax.jms.1.1.jar 不存在（到sun官网上是下载不到的），最好提前将这个jar下载到自己的本地库。
http://mvnrepository.com/artifact/javax.jms/jms/1.1

你贴出的是maven中央仓库地址，如果本地没有网络问题，应该是可以自动编译的。在线编译日志可参考：https://travis-ci.org/wu-sheng/sky-walking/

>加上 -DskipTests， 否则会有测试用例报错。

能反馈是在哪里测试不能通过呢？windows平台？因为我们的travis-ci在linux环境上显示是正常的。

问题1： 不管我本地还是内网的nexus私服， 访问外部网络都不会有问题，报错信息是到sun的一个地址下载jms的jar, 那个路径是不可能下载的到的。 这个因人而异吧， 只是个建议。

问题2：至于junit, 确实是windows平台开发， 刚才-X看了一下， 是 
**ElasticBootstrapTest**
org.junit.ComparisonFailure: Elastic Home : expected:<....\skywalking-storage[\data\]index> but was:<....\skywalking-storage[/data/]index>

**ElasticConfigModifierTest**
java.nio.file.FileSystemException: D:\0.Dev\3.Repository\Github\NicholasQu\sky-walking\skywalking-storage-center\skywalking-storage\target\test-classes\test\config\elasticsearch.yml: 另一个程序正在使用此文件，进程无法访问。

请考虑兼容下。
@NicholasQu , Good to know, Thanks.

`com.a.eye.skywalking.toolkit.activation.log.logback.v1.x.LogbackPatternConverterActivation.getInstanceMethodsInterceptPoints` did not return the right interceptor class name.

- 2.2-2017
```java
return "com.a.eye.skywalking.toolkit.log.logback.v1.x.PrintTraceIdInterceptor";
```

- actual class name
```java
return "com.a.eye.skywalking.toolkit.activation.log.logback.v1.x.PrintTraceIdInterceptor";
```
Fixed, ready to release.

Tested already. Provide `agent.sampling_cycle` in `sky-walking.config` file. 

If `agent.sampling_cycle=n`, meaning, select one trace in every `n` traces.
`agent.sampling_cycle`, default is **1**, means, sampling **OFF**.
UI and Analysis component have no time to support the batch mode. Delay this feature again.
Ref article: https://github.com/wu-sheng/sky-walking/wiki/sky-walking-config-file-walkthrough

In 3.0 . We provide:

- [x] Topological graph of application clusters
- [x] New collector restful service for trace-segments
- [x] Upgrade the distributed trace view

All new UI repository:  [sky-walking-ui](https://github.com/wu-sheng/sky-walking-ui)
